list_definition.definition: to cut with an axe, sword etc
to cut out or shape with an axe, sword etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He hewed a path through the forest.

list_ex_of_english: I hewed to the texture of collective knowledge, took faith in the solid and availing stuff of our experience.
Or would it hew to older historicist and feminist styles?
The men who hew that coal are the lifeblood of the industry.
The people there were hewn out of the rock like the coal that they used to mine.
That man can only be of advantage to the nation by hewing coal, not by unloading rubbish.
As such they are a wonderful mine in which to hew, but that is also a problem.
It shows a woman working with others to hew out a future for herself.
Investment means risks and some losses are necessary for profits to be hewn from enterprise.
